intro: Xanthoxalis albicans, commonly known as the white sand mat, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its small, yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or disturbed soils and is often found in open habitats. It has a low-growing habit with slender stems and is known for its ability to thrive in nutrient-poor environments. Xanthoxalis albicans is also valued for its ornamental appeal due to its delicate foliage and bright yellow blooms.
